Name: Game Maker's Toolkit
Description: Game Maker's Toolkit is a deep dive into game design, level design, and game production, hosted by Mark Brown. Feel free to email me on the business enquire.

Name: Extra Credits
Description: Welcome! We're an educational YouTube channel made up of entertainment enthusiasts with backgrounds in game design, television production, literature, and academia.

Name: 3-Minute Game Design Playlist
Description: Keith Burgun's video series "3 Minute Game Design".

Name: Brackeys Game Dev Tutorials
Description: Learn how to make video games! Top-quality game development tutorials on everything from Unity and programming to game design. If you want to become a developer this channel will help guide you through it!

Name: Mathew Wadstein Tutorials
Description: This channel is dedicated to exploring Unreal Engine 4 and the Blueprint programming language that it uses.  You can think of it as a companion to the API documentation as I try to cover the how and why for what things are used for when using the Blueprint system.

Name: Cagey Videos
Description: Welcome to Cagey Videos. Here, we analyse video games from design, story and gameplay perspectives.

Name: ClassicGameJunkie
Description: Hey, Rob the ClassicGameJunkie here, on this channel you'll find the series "How Did They Do That" along with other random game related videos!

Name: DigiDigger
Description: Hi! Welcome to DigiDigger, I am Digit and I am passionate to share with you the mechanics and inner workings of games as well as the analysis and discussion.

Name: ESVLB Gaming
Description: Hello and welcome to ESVLB Gaming. We're Stefan and Joe, and we love games and want to just share that love with the world. We've been playing games together...

Name: Games As Literature
Description: The home of Games as Lit. 101, a webseries that aims to explore interactive storytelling with analyses and educational videos for gamers and non-gamers alike.

Name: GDC
Description: Welcome to the GDC YouTube channel, where you'll find clips and full length videos from GDC.

Name: Mason Miller
Description: All about video games, why they're awesome, and how they work.

Name: Matthewmatosis
Description: In-depth games reviews and analysis, nothing more; nothing less.

Name: Noah Caldwell-Gervais
Description: In-depth gaming reviews, mostly whole-franchise retrospectives or comparative reviews.

Name: Sunder
Description: My name is Sunder and I make gaming videos ranging from detailed level-design analysis to entertaining reviews! I strive to make things that I'm passionate about.

Name: Super Bunnyhop
Description: Welcome to Super Bunnyhop, where we make pseudo-journalistic content about video games! Your host: George Weidman Updates on Thursdays (sometimes Fridays)

Name: Turbo Button
Description: Just some guy pretending to know things about video games.

Name: What's With Games
Description: What's With Games is a YouTube Channel in which CJ analyzes some feature of games and tells you just what's with it.

Name: Writing on Games
Description: In-depth analysis and opinion pieces on games, their designs and their narratives.

Name: Core-A Gaming
Description: Videos about fighting games.

Name: Math for Game Developers
Description: Math and video games and whatever else I feel like making a video about.

Name: Pixel Prospector
Description: Helpful guides to all things indie dev

Name: Amit's Game Programming Information
Description: Helpful Guides for Programming Games

Name: GameDev.Net
Description: A collection of articles that provide tips and guides on various game development topics

Name: Game Program Patterns
Description: Book on the Design Patterns for Programming Games

Name: Easings.net
Description: Objects in real life donâ€™t just start and stop instantly, and almost never move at a constant speed. When we open a drawer, we first move it quickly, and slow it down as it comes out. Drop something on the floor, and it will first accelerate downwards, and then bounce back up after hitting the floor.

Name: Indie Boothcraft
Description: We know it's not easy to make a game, let alone market that game on tight deadlines, small budgets, and little sleep. Indie Boothcraft is our humble attempt to help indies do well at conventions.

Name: GDC Vault
Description: An archive of videos and powerpoint slides from previous GDC talks and panels.

Name: Take This
Description: Mental Health Organization

Name: IGDA Resources
Description: A collection of articles about a variety of topics focused on the Games Industry and game development

Name: Jason Schreier
Description: Games Journalist and author of Blood, Sweat, and Pixels. Uncovers stories on games production

Name: Indie Game Business Webinar
Description: The Powell Group is a full service consultancy led by a CEO with over two decades of experience in the game industry. Since 2010 we have been helping developers, publishers, technology companies, conferences, and others grow and succeed in the world of video games.

Name: Business of Indie Games
Description: The Business of Indie Games Virtual Summit. How to Thrive in the Strategy, Finance & Marketing of Video Games. Join 5-Day Virtual Summit Focusing on Strategy, Money, Marketing, New Indie Devs & 1 Day Dedicated to Mobile Game Dev. Podcasts about the Business and Marketing of Indie Games.

Name: gameindustry.biz Academy
Description: Collection of Articles with topics and interviews about running a games studio.

Name: Lost Garden
Description: Collection of Essays on Game Design, Art, and Business

Name: VG Insigths Articles
Description: Small Collection of Articles about indie marketing

Name: Moonlight Game Devs
Description: Where Game Developers share their Stories, Guides and Lessons learned. A Blog and Podcast site focused on indie game development.

Name: Xbox Accessibilty Guidelines
Description: Game development documentation for creating accessible games.

Name: Game Accessibility Guidelines
Description: A list of guidelines to make your game more accessible to players

Name: Accessible Player Experiences
Description: The future of Game Accessibility is AbleGamers Accessible Player Experience (APX). 22 design patterns that give you the tools to make accessible games, without the creative limitations that come from standards and guidelines.

Name: IGDA Games Accessibility SIG
Description: The IGDA Game Accessibility Special Interest Group IGDA-GASIG volunteers have worked since 2003 to aid the game industry in making games accessible for all, regardless of impairments or other limitations.

Name: CVAA
Description: The Twenty-First Century Communications and Video Accessibility Act (CVAA) updates federal communications law to increase the access of persons with disabilities to modern communications. The legal requirements in the USA for accessibility of communications. Applies to games with in-game chat or VoIP.

Name: Three Hundred Mechanics
Description: A Site dedicated to documenting 300 different game mechanics

Name: UE4 Resources
Description: A collection of Unreal Engine projects and plugins meant to be a learning resource

Name: Indie Access
Description: Your guide to independent game development and publishing. At Indie Access you'll find best practices, how-tos and Q&As regarding some of the most relevant topics in game development and publishing.

Name: Ctrl+Paint
Description: Digital Painting Tutorials for Beginners

Name: Matthew Ventures Tutorials
Description: Guide on making a Resume, Game Engineer Interview Study Sheet, and breaking into the Games Industry (https://tinyurl.com/hackingGamesV2)

Name: Game Career Guide
Description: Postmortems and career advice for the games industry
